subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: SchemaCrawler has the capability to execute any arbitrary SQL, even if the SQL is database-specific. This example demonstrates how to execute arbitrary SQL.

ol.li: Make sure that the Java executable is on your path.
Copy the SchemaCrawler jar file and schemacrawler.config.properties into the db-specific-query example directory.
Copy the hsqldb jar file from distribution directory into the db-specific-query example directory.
Start the database server by running StartDatabaseServer script from the distribution directory.
Start a command shell in the db-specific-query example directory.
Try modifying the schemacrawler.config.properties with different queries.
Redirect the output of SchemaCrawler into a file, by running db-specific-query.cmd > file.txt.
